dataIdInfo.idAbs: The Divide Polygons by Segments utility tool splits a polygon (i.e. channel buffers, valley bottoms) using the segments from a stream flow or center line. This can be useful for confinement calculations.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Kelly Whitehead, South Fork Research, Inc.

tool.name: DividePolygonBySegmentsTool

param.name: InputFCCenterline
param.dialogReference: Segmented stream network or centerline polyline feature class that will be used to divide the polygon into segments.

param.name: InputFCPolygon
param.dialogReference: Polygon feature class to be segmented by the segmented polyline feature class.

param.name: fcSegmentedPolygons
param.dialogReference: File name and directory location of the output segmented polygon feature class.

param.name: DoublePointDensity
param.dialogReference: Density of Thiessen polygon seed points to use within the Junction Buffer. Higher density should result in a finer resolution of the segmented edges in the output polygon

param.name: dblJunctionBuffer
param.dialogReference: Buffer to limit the generation of Thiessen seed points around tributary junctions only. This parameter an reduce processing time.

tool.summary: The Divide Polygons by Segments utility tool splits a polygon (i.e. channel buffers, valley bottoms) using the segments from a stream flow or center line. This can be useful for confinement calculations.
